alfredsnippet.snippet:
Etienne Klein & Marc Lachi√®ze-Rey, The Quest for Unity - The Adventure of Physics, pp. 98-99

"... quantum physics represents an extreme case. It works perfectly well, but no one knows exactly what it talks about, nor what kind of reality it describes ... The role of theory has become so dominant that it is forcing physics to confront an Oedipal complex over its close relationship with mathematics."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Physics' Oedipal Complex
